contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} The '''value of control''' is a quantitiative measure of the value of controlling the outcome of an [[uncertainty variable]]. [[Decision analysis]] provides a means for calculating the value of both '''perfect''' and '''imperfect control'''. The former value, informally known as the '''value of wizardry''', is an upper bound for the latter. Obtaining meaningful value-of-control measurements requires an awareness of important restrictions (concerning the nature of [[free will]] and the meaning of [[Counterfactual conditional|counterfactual]] statements) on the validity of this kind of analysis. ==See also== *[[Value of information]] *[[Decision wizard|Wizard]] {{Philo-stub}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Value Of Control}} [[Category:Value]] [[Category:Free will]]
